title: Watchstone soars after ending legal battle with Slater & Gordon
text:
Watchstone, the insurance firm formerly known as Quindell, will receive a major cash boost after it settled a £637m claim against it for just £11m.

The £11m sum will be taken from a £50m pot of cash that was being held in escrow until the dispute was resolved.

The agreement will release £39m plus interest to Watchstone that had been tied up in a closed account pending the outcome of the case. A nine-week High Court trial had been due to start on Monday.

The parties also agreed to bear their own costs from the case, so will not apply to court to recover their legal fees.
